moves.1. e4: I wanted a King's Pawn Gambit, but my opponent had other ideas.
moves.2... dxe4 3. Nc3 f5 4. d3 exd3 5. Bxd3 g: This may have cost him the game, as it allows my Dark-sqared Bishop to smoke the Kingside.
moves.6. Nf3 Bg7 7. Nh4: I make a miscalculation with the Scholar's Mate (I think) in mind.
moves.7... Nf6 8. O-O O-O: Bad. There are two diagonals leading into his base...
moves.9. Bc4+: Here I thought that I won his Queen...then I realized I didn't.
moves.9... Kh8: Forcing the King into the corner.
moves.12. b3: I thought here that I would lose. This, I thought, was a mistake. But as it turns out, it really isn't.
moves.12... Ne4 13. Bb2 Nxc3: Then I see a beautiful mate.
moves.14. Re3: He will move his Knight to win my Bishop.
moves.14... Ne4: Looking back, I find that trading Bishops would have not lost me any more material, but I had the desire for a King.
moves.15. Nxg6+: There it is! He must take.
moves.15... hxg6 16. Rh3#: There it is! Once again, the might of aligned Bishops flexes its muscles! His Bishop is pinned, and the g8 square is covered by my White-squared Bishop. Thank you for reading! Please rate and comment!
